lead_paragraph: After bragging that he had unified Republicans in one of the most “love-filled” conventions in history, the nominee went on an extended diatribe against his primary rival.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington, and Amy Chozick from Orlando, Fla.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and ALAN RAPPEPORT

headline.print_headline: Victory Lap for Trump,  Complete With Ax to Grind
headline.main: Donald Trump Basks in Convention ‘Love’ (but Has None for Ted Cruz)

snippet: After bragging that he had unified Republicans in one of the most “love-filled” conventions in history, the nominee went on an extended diatribe against his primary rival....
abstract: Donald Trump delivers extended criticism of Sen Ted Cruz day after Republican National Convention wraps up, preceding his remarks about Cruz with declaration that party is unified; says he would not accept Cruz's endorsement even if it is offered.
